Mr Eric Schmidt , who will become executive chairman of the search giant, said the new structure will produce even better results for the corporation . He explained that the previous structure, in which the triumvirate took collective decisions, had slowed down decision making. allowing staff to search children for any material that may disrupt lessons feature in the Bill, while rules forcing schools to give parents 24-hour notice of a detention will also be scrapped. Mr Michael Gove said: This Michael Government backs teachers. All the evidence from those countries with great education systems tells us that nothing is more important than attracting great people into teaching and supporting them in the classroom. "Teachers will be free to impose the penalties they need to keep order and free from the red tape which swallows up teaching time, so they can get on with their first duty- raising standards. Plans to axe a number of education quangos will feature in the Bill, as will the legislation required to allow the Michael Government to charge university students higher rates of interest on tuition fee loans.
